concepts.sumo_definition:
An Entity that does not exist in space and time in the same way as
   ConcreteEntities, such as numbers, sets, types, and propositions.
concepts.definition: An entity that exists independently of physical space and time, including mathematical objects, logical constructs, and conceptual forms such as numbers, sets, propositions, and types.
Grouping category for UserAction, Maneuver, BodyMotion...

concepts.sumo_definition:
A normal or pathological part
of the anatomy or structural organization of an &%Organism.  This
class covers &%BodyParts, as well as structures that are given off
by &%Organisms, e.g. &%ReproductiveBodies.
concepts.definition: (of genes) producing the same phenotype whether its allele is identical or dissimilar

concepts.sumo_definition:
An &%Object that is the product of a
&%Making.
concepts.definition: an object occurring naturally; not made by man

concepts.sumo_definition:
Something or someone that can act on its own and
produce changes in the world.
concepts.definition: An entity capable of independent action and self-directed behavior that can initiate changes in its environment without external control. This includes both living organisms with volition and artificial systems with autonomous decision-making capabilities.

concepts.sumo_definition: A &%Process embodied in an &%Organism.
concepts.definition: be awake, be alert, be there

concepts.sumo_definition:
A Process internal to a CognitiveSystem that transforms, maintains,
   or uses MentalRepresentations (e.g. perception, retrieval, learning,
   reasoning, planning, decision-making).
concepts.definition:
A Process internal to a CognitiveSystem that transforms, maintains,
   or uses MentalRepresentations (e.g. perception, retrieval, learning,
   reasoning, planning, decision-making).

concepts.sumo_definition: Large-scale environmental problems that threaten ecosystems, human health, or sustainability through resource depletion or contamination.
concepts.definition: Large-scale environmental problems that threaten ecosystems, human health, or sustainability through resource depletion or contamination.

positive_examples: The drought has caused widespread crop failure and water shortages across the region.
Industrial waste has contaminated the groundwater, making it unsafe to drink.
Overgrazing has turned fertile farmland into barren desert over the past decade.
The oil spill devastated marine life and coastal ecosystems for hundreds of miles.
Deforestation has led to massive soil erosion and flooding in the valley.
Chemical runoff from factories has created dead zones in the lake where nothing can survive.
negative_examples: The earthquake damaged several buildings and infrastructure in the city.
Rising sea levels due to climate change will affect coastal communities.
The hurricane brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to the coast.
Scientists are studying long-term climate patterns and temperature trends.
The volcano erupted, sending ash clouds into the atmosphere.
Forest fires spread rapidly due to dry conditions and high winds.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalDisasters, ClimateChange, War, EconomicCrisis, PublicHealthCrisis

concepts.sumo_definition:
Any &%Attribute of an &%Entity that is
an internal property of the &%Entity, e.g. its shape, its color, its fragility,
etc.
concepts.definition: presently existing in fact and not merely potential or possible

concepts.sumo_definition: Any &%Process of movement.
concepts.definition: the act of coming (or going) out; becoming apparent

concepts.sumo_definition:
Generally, a living individual, including all
&%Plants and &%Animals.
concepts.definition: heave or utter a sigh; breathe deeply and heavily

concepts.sumo_definition:
An &%Organization is a
corporate or similar institution. The &%members of an &%Organization
typically have a common purpose or function. Note that this class also
covers divisions, departments, etc. of organizations.  For example,
both the Shell Oil Corporation and the accounting department at Shell
would both be instances of &%Organization.  Note too that the
existence of an &%Organization is dependent on the existence of at
least one &%member (since &%Organization is a subclass of
&%Collection).  Accordingly, in cases of purely legal organizations, a
fictitious &%member should be assumed.
concepts.definition: secret aid to escaping slaves that was provided by abolitionists in the years before the American Civil War
Grouping category for ArchitectureRepresentation, Brand, ContentBearingObject...

concepts.sumo_definition:
&%Propositions are &%Abstract entities that
express a complete thought or a set of such thoughts.  As an example,
the formula '(instance Yojo Cat)' expresses the &%Proposition that the
entity named Yojo is an element of the &%Class of Cats.  Note that
propositions are not restricted to the content expressed by individual
sentences of a &%Language.  They may encompass the content expressed by
theories, books, and even whole libraries.  It is important to distinguish
&%Propositions from the &%ContentBearingObjects that express them.  A
&%Proposition is a piece of information, e.g. that the cat is on the mat,
but a &%ContentBearingObject is an &%Object that represents this information.
A &%Proposition is an abstraction that may have multiple representations:
strings, sounds, icons, etc.  For example, the &%Proposition that the cat is
on the mat is represented here as a string of graphical characters displayed
on a monitor and/or printed on paper, but it can be represented by a sequence
of sounds or by some non-latin alphabet or by some cryptographic form.
concepts.definition: being of the nature of a notion or concept

concepts.sumo_definition:
Any specification of how many or how much of
something there is.  Accordingly, there are two subclasses of &%Quantity:
&%Number (how many) and &%PhysicalQuantity (how much).
concepts.definition: with a finite limit

concepts.sumo_definition:
A topographic location.
&%Regions encompass surfaces of &%Objects, imaginary places, and
&%GeographicAreas. Note that a &%Region is the only kind of &%Object
which can be located at itself. Note too that &%Region is not a
subclass of &%SelfConnectedObject, because some &%Regions, e.g.
archipelagos, have &%parts which are not &%connected with one
another.
concepts.definition: a point or extent in space

concepts.sumo_definition:
An Entity whose instances hold between ordered tuples of Entities
   (e.g. partOf, causes, realizes).
concepts.definition: a whole (a thing or person) of the same kind or category as another

concepts.sumo_definition:
Any &%Attribute that an &%Entity has
by virtue of a relationship that it bears to another &%Entity or set of &%Entities,
e.g. &%SocialRoles and &%PositionalAttributes.
concepts.definition: further or added

concepts.sumo_definition:
An investment instrument, other than an insurance policy or 
&%FixedAnnuity insurance policy or fixed annuity issued by a corporation, government, 
or other organization which offers evidence of debt or equity.
concepts.definition: a security issued by United States government agencies or the Farm Credit System

concepts.sumo_definition:
The &%SetOrClass of &%Sets
and &%Classes, i.e. any instance of &%Abstract that has &%elements or
&%instances.
concepts.definition: a population that is part of a larger population

concepts.sumo_definition: Human activities and behaviors involving interaction, work, recreation, and spiritual practices within society.
concepts.definition: Human activities and behaviors involving interaction, work, recreation, and spiritual practices within society.

positive_examples: She joined a book club to meet new people in her neighborhood.
The team worked together to complete the project on deadline.
They went hiking as a family bonding activity on weekends.
The community gathered at the temple for evening prayers.
He volunteered at the local food bank every Saturday morning.
The children played soccer together in the park after school.
negative_examples: The plant grew taller in the sunlight each day.
Her heart rate increased during the medical examination.
The bacteria multiplied rapidly in the petri dish.
The lion hunted alone across the savanna at dawn.
Photosynthesis converts carbon dioxide into oxygen in leaves.
The injured bird's wing healed naturally over several weeks.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: BiologicalProcesses, AnimalBehavior, PlantLife, HealthAndMedicine

concepts.sumo_definition:
An &%Object in which every part is similar to
every other in every relevant respect.  More precisely, something is a
&%Substance when it has only arbitrary pieces as parts - any parts have
properties which are similar to those of the whole.  Note that a &%Substance
may nonetheless have physical properties that vary.  For example, the
temperature, chemical constitution, density, etc. may change from one part
to another.  An example would be a body of water.
concepts.definition: having the characteristics of an acid
